SEARCH
Package careerhub.models

Class Opportunity

java.lang.Object
careerhub.models.Opportunity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Internship
public abstract class Opportunity extends Object
Abstract base class for various types of opportunities offered in the system (currently implemented only as internships). This class provides shared attributes such as ID, title, and opening/closing dates, allowing subclasses to build on common behaviour while defining their own application rules.

The isOpen() method is intentionally abstract because each subclass (e.g., Internship) has its own eligibility logic based on status, visibility, date range, and capacity constraints.

  • Constructor Details

    • Opportunity

      public Opportunity(String id, String title, Date openingDate, Date closingDate)
      Constructs a generic Opportunity with shared attributes.
      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier (may be null initially for auto-generation)
      title - title or name of the opportunity
      openingDate - date when applications open (nullable)
      closingDate - date when applications close (nullable)

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public String getId()
      Returns the unique identifier of this opportunity.
      Returns:
      the opportunity ID

    • setId

      public void setId(String id)
      Assigns a system-generated identifier after the object is constructed. Used by DataManager when loading or persisting opportunities.
      Parameters:
      id - system-generated opportunity ID

      public Date getClosingDate()
      Retrieves the closing date when applications end.
      Returns:
      the closing Date, or null if not set

    • isOpen

      public abstract boolean isOpen()
      Determines whether the opportunity is currently open for applications. Subclasses must implement specific rules, which may include:
      • Approval status
      • Visibility settings
      • Date range checks
      • Remaining slot availability
      Returns:
      true if applications are currently allowed
